intro: Ozothamnus vauvilliersii, commonly known as the Vauvilliers' golden bush, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in dense clusters, which bloom in the spring. Its leaves are typically narrow and covered in fine, silky hairs, giving them a soft appearance. Ozothamnus vauvilliersii is well adapted to arid conditions and thrives in well-drained soils.
